meanings.definition: Having far-reaching and typically disastrous consequences.
meanings.sent1: The fateful decision led to a chain of unfortunate events.
meanings.sent2: The outcome of the fateful choice changed everything.
meanings.sent3: It was a fateful mistake to trust the mischievous squirrel with the acorns.
meanings.sent4: The fateful storm swept away all hopes of a peaceful evening.
meanings.sent5: The fateful meeting between the two rivals ended in chaos and confusion.

meanings.sent1: Her fateful encounter with the mysterious stranger changed her life forever.
meanings.sent2: The hero's fateful journey was foretold by the ancient prophecy.
meanings.sent3: The fateful cat seemed to know exactly when dinner time was.
meanings.sent4: In the fateful game of chess, every move seemed predetermined.
meanings.sent5: The fateful bond between the twins was unbreakable, as if written in the stars.
